intro: Luitkea, commonly known as the "sea holly," is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flower heads, which are surrounded by spiny, leaf-like bracts. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of salt-excreting glands. Luitkea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
